answers.text:
Salt Lake City, Utah requires alcohol serving establishments to get a license and meet zoning requirements.  Some of the criteria include the businesses be more than 600 feet from parks, schools and churches.  
The city is also divided up into different districts.  In District A there can be no more than 2 alcohol establishments per linear block.  In district B establishments can't be closer than 600 feet to each other, and in district C establishments have to be 2,000 feet from each other.
The license is also dependent on getting a license from the State's Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control, and they have their own requirements for granting a license.
For more information contact the Salt Lake City Business Licensing Division at 801.535.6644
